column5: Checked the weather this morning.. everywhere in the southern ontario got rain, EXCEPT Barrie..perfect time to hit up the Gbay tribs!! fished for several hours till the rain came and called it a day.  Got to the pool with 4 guys telling me no action since 9am, off to a bad start already?!  anyways.. 2nd drift on a roe bag and fish on! spunky little dropback    tied on a new roe bag, first drift....fish on!!    I only brought about 6 roe bags today since i was too lazy to tie more, so i just used the remaining from last time..and the water was too perfect to not use artificials.. bait of choice: white jig.   there she goes...    didn't get any hits on the white jig so i switched up to a purple bugger.. i had a few bumps but no takers, then all of a sudden the float shots down like a bullet...another spunky little guy     majority of the fish caught today were in the 2-3lb range..no monsters..but im sure they are starving and will hit anything thats going down the river.
Looks like a great day out...Congrats on getting into them.  Those bows are almost snake-like...They gotta be hankering for some munchies.
Another great report    Looks like a fun time catching them steels... congratulations and thanks for sharing Leechman
I never fish that part of the river, perhaps I should try  Good report!!
Nice job man, look's like nice water out that way.  Keep it up!
